definitions.text: a decorative texture or appearance of a surface (or the substance that gives it that appearance)
examples: the boat had a metallic finish
he applied a coat of a clear finish
when the finish is too thin it is difficult to apply evenly

definitions.text: the temporal end; the concluding time
examples: the stopping point of each round was signaled by a bell
the market was up at the finish
they were playing better at the close of the season

definitions.text: a highly developed state of perfection; having a flawless or impeccable quality; ; ; --Joseph Conrad
examples: they performed with great polish
I admired the exquisite refinement of his prose
almost an inspiration which gives to all work that finish which is almost art

definitions.text: the place designated as the end (as of a race or journey)
examples: a crowd assembled at the finish
he was nearly exhausted as their destination came into view

definitions.text: designated event that concludes a contest (especially a race)
examples: excitement grew as the finish neared
my horse was several lengths behind at the finish
the winner is the team with the most points at the finish

definitions.text: the downfall of someone (as of persons on one side of a conflict)
examples: booze will be the finish of him
it was a fight to the finish
his death marked the ending of an era
when these final episodes are broadcast it will be the finish of the show

definitions.text: (wine tasting) the taste of a wine on the back of the tongue (as it is swallowed)
examples: the wine has a nutty flavor and a pleasant finish
his best finish in a major tournament was third
the speaker's finishing was greeted with applause

definitions.text: come or bring to a finish or an end
examples: He finished the dishes
She completed the requirements for her Master's Degree
The fastest runner finished the race in just over 2 hours; others finished in over 4 hours
He ended up marrying his high school sweetheart
he wound up being unemployed and living at home again

definitions.text: have an end, in a temporal, spatial, or quantitative sense; either spatial or metaphorical
examples: the bronchioles terminate in a capillary bed
Your rights stop where you infringe upon the rights of other
My property ends by the bushes
The symphony ends in a pianissimo
The carpenter finished the table beautifully
this shirt is not finished properly

definitions.text: finish eating all the food on one's plate or on the table
examples: She polished off the remaining potatoes

definitions.text: cause to finish a relationship with somebody
examples: That finished me with Mary
